conversation.Prompt: What are some warning signs that I may be exploited by someone claiming to help me?
conversation.Response: The content highlights various forms of exploitation and manipulation that may be present in a job offer, including offering unrealistically high salaries, forcing work or services without consent, withholding identification documents and personal means of communication, imposing strict rules and control, restricting freedom of movement, and exploiting through labor or sex acts to repay debts. It also mentions instances where working conditions are not respected, payment is not fulfilled as promised, or control over money is maintained by the employer. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking.

conversation.Prompt: How can I protect myself from human trafficking?
conversation.Response: It is important to know your rights and where you can access services, help, and support. It is advised to maintain possession of your documents and keep in touch with people who may support you, such as those from your community, family, friends, or other support structures. It is recommended to have enough information about your travel plans, including who you are traveling with, the route you will take, the address you will be staying at, any workplace or employer you may be going to, and share this information with trusted individuals. Additionally, developing a secret 'safeword' or phrase with trusted person(s) can help in signaling that you are in trouble. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking.

conversation.Prompt: How can I report sexual exploitation and abuse committed by humanitarian workers?
conversation.Response: Sexual exploitation and abuse refer to any actual or attempted abuse of power or trust for sexual purposes, as well as any forced or coerced sexual activity. This can happen to anyone, regardless of age or gender. If you suspect sexual exploitation or abuse by a UNHCR, UN, or NGO staff member, you can report it directly to UNHCR Romania. Include details of the incident, the individuals involved, and when and where it occurred in your report. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking.
